considered to provide adequate protection for 4 to 6 months ( 84). Most children in this age 
group tolerate these doses of vitamin A well, though temporary side effects such as headache, 
nausea or vomiting and diarrhoea have been reported in a small percentage of cases ( 85). On 
a per-child basis, the cost of vitamin A supplementation is considered inexpensive. Most of the
